customdata:
The Unidata network Common Data Form (netCDF) in Python is an
interface for scientific data access and a set of freely-
distributed software libraries that provide an implementation of
the interface.

A Python interface to map GRIB files to the NetCDF Common Data
Model following the CF Convention using ecCodes.
Python API to access the Copernicus Climate Data Store.

Access and analyze historical weather and climate data with
Python.

An intake plugin for parsing an Earth System Model catalog and
loading assets into xarray datasets.

A library of derived climate variables, i.e. climate indicators,
based on xarray.

Python library for climate indices and climate indicators
calculation.
A Python application for modeling the urban heat island effect.

An open source project and Python package that provides
verification metrics of deterministic (and probabilistic from
properscoring) forecasts with xarray.

A Python package for data-wrangling, analysis and visualization
of integrated-assessment scenarios and energy systems modeling
results.

An open source catastrophe modelling platform, free to use by
anyone.
A package to simplify the download of ECMWF open data.

A Python package aiming at simplifying access to climate and
meteorological datasets, allowing users to focus on science
instead of technical issues such as data access and data
formats.

Allows users to compute seismic hazard and seismic risk of
earthquakes on a global scale.

A Python package for analyzing general circulation model output
data.
Python library for modeling aviation climate impacts.

A powerful, format-agnostic, community-driven Python package for
analyzing and visualizing Earth science data.
data.name: Climate Change

customdata:
A set of documented functions for simulating the performance of
photovoltaic energy systems.

A graphic tool used by meteorologists to give a succinct view of
how wind speed and direction are typically distributed at a
particular location.

Thermodynamics, phase equilibrium, transport properties and
chemical database component of Chemical Engineering Design
Library.

Read energy usage data from the real-time API on Solax solar
inverters.
A library to model the output of wind turbines and farms.

A controls-oriented engineering wake modeling framework for
evaluating the impact of wind farm controls on AEP and wind farm
design.

An AEP calculator for wind farms implemented in Python including
a collection of wake models.

A multi-scale, Python-based library for the modeling of solar
cells and semiconductor materials.

A scientific open source project for the development of
numerical methods for the simulation of thermo-hydro-mechanical-
chemical processes in porous and fractured media.

An open source toolbox for the evaluation of thermal response
factors of geothermal borehole fields.

Open source view-factor model for diffuse shading and bifacial
PV modeling.

Allows for reproducible research both for photovoltaics systems
performance and solar radiation.

An open source library to support reproducible technical
analysis of time series data from photovoltaic energy systems.
data.name: Renewable Energy

customdata:
Fetch NCDC ISD, TMY3, or CZ2010 weather data that corresponds to
ZIP Code Tabulation Areas or Latitude/Longitude.

A collection of tools in Python for reading, visualizing and
performing calculations with weather data.

Trying to make access to weather data in Python feel like a warm
summer breeze.

Several functions and utilities that make R better for handling
meteorological data in the tidy data paradigm.

A collection of diagnostic and interpolation routines for use
with output from the Weather Research and Forecasting Model.

A python package that downloads recent and archived numerical
weather prediction model output from different cloud archive
sources.

The Atmospheric data Community Toolkit is an open source Python
toolkit for working with atmospheric time-series datasets of
varying dimensions.
data.name: Atmosphere

customdata: Python implementation of the Open Charge Point Protocol.

A npm module for accessing the green web API, and estimating the
carbon emissions from using digital services.

A tool to estimate energy use (kilowatt-hours) and carbon
emissions (metric tons CO2e) from public cloud usage.

Package to calculate several thermal comfort indices (e.g. PMV,
PPD, SET, adaptive) and convert physical variables.

An extensive collection of datasets from agricultural
experiments.
Mobility as a Service API - data model, tests and validation.
Python Tesla Powerwall API for consuming a local endpoint.

Import GTFS transit data into SQLite and query routes, stops,
times, fares and more.

Provides a powerful simulation toolkit for thermal engineering
plants such as power plants, district heating systems or heat
pumps.
data.name: Consumption

customdata:
A set of toolkits that together provide a system for issuance
and management of Energy Attribute Certificates.

A Python client for the ENTSO-E API (European Network of
Transmission System Operators for Electricity).

An open source Python package for implementing and developing
standard methods for calculating normalized metered energy
consumption and avoided energy use.

A free software toolbox for simulating and optimizing modern
power systems that include features such as conventional
generators with unit commitment, variable wind and solar
generation, storage units, coupling to other energy sectors, and
mixed alternating and direct current networks.

A Python-based package for electrical grid optimization based on
the Pyomo optimization modeling language.

Provides standardized API to access energy data from the major
Independent System Operators in the United States.

Design Reinforcement Learning environments that model Active
Network Management tasks in electricity distribution networks.

Wrapper for the Balancing Mechanism Reporting Service API to
balance power flowing on to and off from the electricity
Transmission System in Great Britain.

Aims to be a complete platform for power systems research and
simulation.

Light-weight version of Aarhus RE Atlas for converting weather
data to power systems data.

A testbed platform to model sequential decision making in power
systems.

An easy-to-use Power System Analysis Automation Platform atop
PowerWorld's Simulator Automation Server.

Official reinforcement learning environment for demand response
and load shaping.

A Python package which uses different machine learning
algorithms for the aggregation of time series.
data.name: Energy Systems

customdata:
Create a canvas visualization layer for direction and intensity
of arbitrary velocities (e.g. wind, ocean current).
An R package for oceanographic processing.

A Python wrapper for the NOAA CO-OPS Tides & Currents Data and
Metadata APIs.
data.name: Hydrosphere

customdata:
Download and process satellite imagery in Python using Sentinel
Hub services.

Makes searching, downloading and retrieving the metadata of
Sentinel satellite images from the Copernicus Open Access Hub
easy.

A python module for interfacing with the US Geological Survey's
API.

A python library for reading and manipulating meteorological
remote sensing data and writing it to various image and data
file formats.

Provides access to various data sources published by Environment
and Climate Change Canada.

A collection of Python utilities for retrieving atmospheric and
oceanic data from remote sources, focusing on being able to
retrieve data from Unidata data technologies.

A ninja python package that unifies the Google Earth Engine
ecosystem.

R tools to access open data from Eurostat, the statistical
office of the European Union.

Provides intuitive programming libraries to process a wide
variety of earth observation datasets.

An R API package that helps to retrieve data from Eurostat
Geographic Information System of the Commission.
Radiant MLHub Python Client

Open community commons for geospatial training data, machine
learning models, and standards to encourage collaboration and
share information.

Search, download or stream NASA Earth science data with just a
few lines of code.
Digital Earth Africa Notebooks

Using Earth observations to address social, environmental and
economic changes on the Africa continent.
data.name: Sustainable Development
y: Radiant MLHub Python Client
Digital Earth Africa Notebooks

customdata:
Enables quantitative analysis of environmental audio, offering
tools for processing, segmenting, and computing acoustic
features.

Provides R functions to conduct typical introductory fisheries
analyses.

An R package for airborne LiDAR data manipulation and
visualization for forestry application.
Python Package for Tree Crown Detection in Airborne RGB imagery.

R package for automated runs and evaluations of ecological niche
models.

R package for spatial analysis and modelling of ecological
systems.

Python client for iNaturalist, a community science platform that
helps people get involved in the natural world by observing and
identifying the living things around them.

Contains data for use in common fisheries stock analyses. See
installation instructions further below.
data.name: Biosphere

customdata: Fast and flexible physics-based battery models in Python.

Database with battery parameters based on PerMod as well as
functions in order to simulate battery storages.
data.name: Energy Storage

customdata:
An R package developed for the purpose of analyzing air quality
data — or more generally atmospheric composition data.

A Python package to create, run, and post-process MODFLOW-based
models.

A water resources model, designed to be the replacement of the
regional surface water modules Mozart and SIMRES in the
Netherlands Hydrological Instrument.
Water Network Tool for Resilience

A Python package designed to simulate and analyze resilience of
water distribution networks.

Algorithms for Quantitative Pedology is a collection of code,
ideas, documentation, and examples wrapped-up into several R
packages.
Landscape Metrics for Categorical Map Patterns in R.

Computing the Standardized Precipitation-Evapotranspiration
Index and other reference evapotranspiration.
Simplified Access to NCSS Soil Databases.
data.name: Natural Resources
y: Water Network Tool for Resilience

customdata: An open source framework for life cycle assessment.
data.name: Industrial Ecology

customdata: National Carbon Credit Registry

As an online database using national and international standards
for quantifying and verifying greenhouse gas emissions
reductions by programmes.
data.name: Emissions
y: National Carbon Credit Registry

title.text: Packages with the most downloads in the last month
